alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Robertson; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:57PM CDT until July 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR DICKSON...MONTGOMERY...SOUTHERN STEWART...HOUSTON...CHEATHAM... HUMPHREYS AND WESTERN ROBERTSON COUNTIES... At 256 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pembroke to 13 miles south of Clarksville to 8 miles northwest of Waverly, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Springfield, Dickson, Ashland City, Waverly, Camden, Dover, Erin, Coopertown, White Bluff, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Guthrie, Tennessee Ridge, Hurricane Mills, Pleasant View, Charlotte, Adams and Vanleer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 134 and 136. Interstate 24 between mile markers 1 and 31. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Dickson; Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Robertson; Stewart
